engine_version: 3.6 -- v3-6 signal scan (43 signals + 10 counter-signals across all 6 forces), 32 deep-dive cards scored and integrated (293→325), sector screener identifies next 10 deep-dive candidates, 3 new patterns confirmed

key_metrics.humanoid_robots: China 90% global market — Unitree 5,500 shipped, AgiBot 5,168 shipped, exceeding Tesla target. Tesla Optimus Gen 3 mass production launched Jan 21 but 'no useful work' yet (Musk Jan 28)
key_metrics.open_source_gap: DeepSeek V4 expected ~Feb 17 with Engram memory, targeting Opus 4.5 SWE-bench parity. Open-proprietary lag approaching real-time
key_metrics.ai_coding: 25-40% of Google code AI-generated BUT experienced devs 19% SLOWER on complex tasks (perception-reality gap). Gains concentrated in narrow workflows (20-30%)
key_metrics.fda_ai_devices: 1,250+ cumulative. FDA DEREGULATED AI clinical decision support Jan 6, 2026 — AI single-recommendation CDS exempt from device regulation
key_metrics.enterprise_adoption: 78% (McKinsey), 95% GenAI (Bain). $37B GenAI spending 2025 (3.2x YoY). But EBIT impact still rare. Shift to disciplined deployment (fewer licenses, higher spend/license)
key_metrics.ai_agents: OpenAI Frontier enterprise agent platform launched Feb 5. Claude Opus 4.6 agent teams (multi-agent parallel decomposition). Frontier capability unlocked.
key_metrics.nvidia_backlog: 3.6M Blackwell units, $500B orders through 2026, GPU cabinets 28K→60K+. CoWoS/HBM multi-year shortage
key_metrics.anticipatory_displacement: HBR: 60% of orgs reduced headcount anticipating AI, only 2% tied to actual AI implementation. Companies acting on potential, not performance
key_metrics.maven_ai: DoD Maven targeting 100% machine-generated intel by mid-2026

F1_technology.direction: Frontier capability steepening: Opus 4.6 agent teams + OpenAI Frontier platform = multi-agent orchestration era. Open-source approaching real-time parity (DeepSeek V4). China won humanoid robot volume race (90% market). FDA deregulated AI CDS. BUT: experienced devs 19% SLOWER on complex AI-assisted tasks reveals Solow Paradox deeper than assumed. Enterprise ROI shifting from 'try everything' to 'prove ROI' — Installation→Deployment transition in enterprise AI.

key_metrics.us_silver_tsunami: 52.3% of employer businesses owned by 55+, 2.34M businesses. $68T total boomer wealth transfer by 2030 including $5.1T in small business value. 12M businesses changing hands this decade.
key_metrics.succession_gap: 58% have no succession plan, 70% never successfully sell
key_metrics.japan_population: Declining ~919K/yr, sub-670K births 2025 (new record low). $22.3B annual family spending from FY2026
key_metrics.china_births: 7.92M in 2025 (-17% YoY), comparable to 1738 levels. Women 20-34 declining from 105M to 58M by 2050 — irreversible
key_metrics.us_labor_market: Jan 2026 BLS: +130K jobs (healthcare +82K dominates). BUT 898K DOWNWARD REVISION to 2025 employment. JOLTS plunged to 6.54M (0.87 jobs/worker — reversal from 2+ in 2022). Market restructuring, not collapsing.
key_metrics.college_enrollment_cliff: 15% decline projected 2025-2029, up to 80 additional closures, 400 total possible this decade. 5 states = 75% of decline (IL, CA, NY, PA, MI). $18B endowment redistribution
key_metrics.h1b_impact: $100K fee crystallizing: startups 10-20% of revenue, IT services $500M+. Wage-weighted lottery effective Feb 27, 2026. 2 major lawsuits filed
key_metrics.entry_level_collapse: 67% drop in junior developer hiring 2024-2026. 35% all entry-level decline (Revelio Labs). 37% managers prefer AI over Gen Z hire. Only 7% of 2024 hires were recent grads
key_metrics.trades_shortage: 499K new workers needed in building trades (2026)
key_metrics.pipeline_collapse: CPA -33%, nursing 78K->200K, teaching 42 states (411K vacant), trucking age 57
key_metrics.india_dividend: 1.44B population, 1B working-age, median 28. Zero-tax-through-2047 for AI. $70-100B hyperscaler commitments

F2_demographics.direction: UPGRADED steady→accelerating. Silver Tsunami now quantified at $68T total transfer including $5.1T in small business value. China birth collapse irreversible (women 20-34 declining 45% by 2050). US labor market RESTRUCTURING not collapsing — healthcare dominates job creation while finance/tech contract. Entry-level hiring in structural collapse (67% junior devs, 35% all entry-level). College enrollment cliff hitting NOW with geographic concentration in 5 states.

key_metrics.us_china_tariffs: 47.5% avg US tariff on China (100% coverage). Nov 2025 truce through Nov 10, 2026 at risk — Iran 25% tariff threatens destabilization
key_metrics.eu_ai_act: Digital Omnibus delays high-risk Annex III from Aug 2026 to Dec 2027 (16mo). Conditional on standards readiness. Creates regulatory uncertainty window
key_metrics.rearm_europe: EUR 800B ReArm Europe/Readiness 2030 — 1.5% GDP fiscal escape clause (EUR 650B), EUR 150B SAFE loans. Drones and air defense prioritized
key_metrics.india_ai: Zero taxes on cloud/AI revenues through 2047. $70-100B from Google/Amazon/Microsoft. AI Impact Summit Feb 16-20 (first Global South). 9.2 GW data center target by 2030
key_metrics.aukus: Pillar II autonomous warfare trials expanding 2026. AI models proven interoperable across US/UK/Australia platforms
key_metrics.china_chips: 3 new AI chip fabs by late 2026, 80% domestic demand capture target. 25% US 'security tariff' on chip exports. Busan 1-year suspension
key_metrics.gulf_ai: $200B+ combined Saudi/UAE. HUMAIN deploying 18,000 GB300s. UAE Stargate 1GW cluster (G42/OpenAI/Oracle/Nvidia/SoftBank). Positioning as neutral compute hub in US-China bifurcation
key_metrics.defense_spending: $2,750B global defense (9.4%+ YoY). NATO 5% GDP target. DoD $961.6B base + $150B reconciliation. $13.4B AI/autonomy line
key_metrics.us_ai_regulation: Trump EO creates AI Litigation Task Force vs 280 bipartisan state lawmakers. Federal preemption uncertain — EO cannot overturn state law. March 11 Commerce/FTC deadlines imminent
key_metrics.cmmc_enforcement: CMMC 2.0 enforcement begins, 220K+ DIB companies must certify

F3_geopolitics.direction: Multiple escalation vectors. ReArm Europe EUR 800B is the largest European defense mobilization since Cold War. India executing zero-tax-through-2047 AI attraction at unprecedented scale. Gulf $200B+ positioning as neutral third node between US-China. US-China tariff truce at risk from Iran linkage. EU AI Act high-risk delayed 16 months. Federal-state AI regulation tension creates maximum compliance uncertainty.

key_metrics.fed_funds: 3.50-3.75% (Jan 2026 hold). 2 FOMC dissents favoring cut. Futures: at most 2 cuts in 2026, ZERO in 2027. Higher-for-longer structural
key_metrics.cre_cmbs: Office CMBS delinquency 12.34% — ALL-TIME RECORD, 1.6pp above 2008 Financial Crisis peak. $1.6B net monthly increase. $936B-$1.8T CRE maturing 2026. New loan rate 6.24% vs 4.76% expiring (148bp gap)
key_metrics.ai_mega_rounds: Anthropic $20B at $350B (doubled in 5mo). OpenAI $100B at $830B. xAI $20B at $230B. Humans& $480M seed at $4.48B. Total Jan-Feb 2026 frontier raises >$140B
key_metrics.defense_tech: $17.9B equity funding 2025 (2.45x YoY). Exits record $54.4B (3x YoY). Nvidia/Groq $20B. 41% more active defense investors. Exits > investment = Deployment phase signal
key_metrics.pe_distress: Bankruptcies trending up early 2026. Most exposed: retail, dining, RE, energy, healthcare, education. PE dry powder positioning for aggressive middle-market M&A. Private credit as dominant distress liquidity source
key_metrics.sp500_concentration: Top 10 = 40% of index weight (all-time record). Forward P/E 22x (matches 2021 peak). But Mag 7 earnings share declining to 31% — broadening
key_metrics.vc_2026: 10-25% funding increase expected. AI + robotics + defense gaining share. Climate, crypto, undifferentiated AI losing. Secondaries becoming mainstream liquidity

F4_capital.direction: Office CMBS hits all-time record 12.34% — WORSE than 2008 Financial Crisis. AI mega-rounds at unprecedented scale ($140B+ in Jan-Feb 2026 alone). Defense tech exits ($54.4B) exceeding investment ($49.1B) = first AI sector entering Deployment phase. Market concentration at record (top 10 = 40%) while earnings broaden — late Installation signature. Higher-for-longer confirmed (zero 2027 cuts priced).

key_metrics.worker_fear: ESCALATED: 60% expect AI to cut more jobs than it adds (from 40% in v3-4). 51% worried about own job. 1 in 5 knows someone who lost job to AI — fear transitioning from abstract to experiential
key_metrics.ai_washing_layoffs: 108,435 Jan 2026 job cuts (+118% YoY). HBR: 60% orgs cut headcount anticipating AI, only 2% tied to actual implementation. 'Forever layoffs' amid profits
key_metrics.entry_level_extinction: 67% junior dev hiring collapse. 37% managers prefer AI over Gen Z. 35% all entry-level decline. Pipeline destruction with decade-lag leadership consequences
key_metrics.k_shaped_sentiment: Michigan 57.3 (6-mo high). 7-point gap: wealthy (stock-driven) vs hourly workers. Spending strong despite low confidence — behavioral decoupling
key_metrics.deepfake_trust_collapse: Europol: 90% of online content may be synthetic by 2026. 8M deepfakes 2025 (16x from 2023). 'Liar's Dividend' — authentic content dismissed as fake
key_metrics.enterprise_roi: $37B GenAI spent 2025 (3.2x). 66% productivity gains. But enterprise-wide EBIT rare. Fewer licenses, higher spend — disciplined deployment
key_metrics.education_fear: Brookings: AI risks outweigh benefits for children (50-country study). Ohio mandates AI frameworks by Jul 2026. Michigan proposes chatbot liability for minors. Alpha School parents report child anxiety
key_metrics.state_regulation_wave: 2026 bills target NEW categories: agentic AI, algorithmic pricing, chatbot liability for minors. Colorado AI Act effective 2026. Liability shifting from governance to outcomes
key_metrics.generational_divide: Gen Z 67% excited vs Boomers 29% excited / 51% worried. Boomer confidence dropped 35%

F5_psychology.direction: UPGRADED shifting→accelerating. Worker fear now experiential (1 in 5 knows someone affected), not just anticipatory. AI-washing confirmed as mainstream corporate behavior (60% cut for potential, 2% for performance). Entry-level extinction is structural (67% junior devs). K-shaped psychology: capital-owners recovering confidence while labor remains anxious. Deepfake scale creating systemic trust collapse (Europol 90% projection). Education fear crystallizing with first legislative responses (Michigan chatbot liability). State regulation evolving from governance to liability.

key_metrics.data_center_electricity: IEA: doubling to 945 TWh global by 2030. US: 133% growth to 426 TWh. AI servers growing 30%/yr (4x other sectors). Occupancy 95%+ peak late 2026
key_metrics.grid_bottleneck: 2,600 GW in queue, 5+ year wait — THE binding constraint on AI scaling
key_metrics.pjm_capacity: $16.4B auction (3rd consecutive record). Price at $333/MW-day CAP. Data centers 63% of price increase. 8+ year queue wait
key_metrics.zero_water_cooling: Microsoft piloting zero-water-evaporation cooling in Phoenix and Wisconsin (2026). Trades water for energy — resource substitution
key_metrics.copper: Conflicting: ICSG 150K deficit vs Red Cloud 126K surplus (tariff demand destruction). Citi $13-15K/tonne. Long-term: 766K deficit by 2030. DC demand 330-500K tonnes/yr by 2030
key_metrics.renewable_policy: One Big Beautiful Bill terminates residential solar credit Dec 2025. Wind/solar phase-out for construction after Jul 2026. Solar LCOE still competitive ($38-78/MWh) but 15-30% more expensive without credits
key_metrics.nuclear_renaissance: 10GW+ committed for AI (TMI restart, Kairos SMR, Talen). QCEW: nuclear employment (38K workers) at Baumol 2.22
key_metrics.solar_growth: Solar electric (221114) employment +51.6% YoY — fastest-growing sub-sector in entire QCEW dataset
key_metrics.water_stress: 1.7B gallons/day for data center cooling globally. Microsoft zero-water pilot is first hyperscaler response

F6_energy.direction: IEA confirms doubling to 945 TWh by 2030. PJM at 3rd consecutive record auction ($16.4B). Data center occupancy projected 95%+ by late 2026 — physical capacity crisis. Policy headwind: One Big Beautiful Bill terminates renewable credits, creating rush-to-build then cliff. Microsoft solving water with energy tradeoff. Solar employment exploding (+51.6%) even as policy shifts against it. Copper signal conflicting near-term but deficit trajectory from 2027+.

Mortgage servicing most extreme labor signal: 13.8% wage growth AND -10.7% employment simultaneously. RIA sector (523940) has 496K workers at $270K avg and extreme fragmentation — identified by sector screener as next FS deep-dive target.

Legal services (5411) has highest fear friction of any professional sector at 82% ethical concern. IT services (5415) is self-disrupting: 2.46M workers, AI coding 19% SLOWER for experienced devs. Sector screener identifies 5415 as standalone deep-dive candidate.

Jan 2026 BLS: construction +33K. Data center construction driving demand. 70 GW solar deployment rush before Jul 2026 credit expiration. AEC design card (5413-001) scored 68.5.
Zero-density Schumpeterian gap persists. US-China tariff truce at risk could disrupt trade flows.

Nvidia/Groq $20B validates defense-AI hardware convergence.

Michigan chatbot liability for minors. Fear economy card (EDU-FEAR-01: 72.25) confirms fear creates market. College cliff NOW: 400 schools could close this decade, $18B endowment redistribution, 5 states = 75% of decline.

running_patterns.economy_map_relevance: v3-6: CMMC card scored highest of all 32 new cards (82.5). Regulatory moat thesis confirmed by scoring data.

running_patterns.economy_map_relevance: v3-6: 8 education cards scored, confirming sequence. Corporate (74.5) > Teacher (72.25) > University (67.5) > K-12 Tutoring (62.25).

running_patterns.description: Anticipatory Displacement: 60% of companies cut headcount for AI potential not performance. 108K Jan 2026 layoffs (+118% YoY). HBR/Oxford Economics confirm firms NOT replacing workers with AI at scale. Fear-driven self-fulfilling prophecy.
running_patterns.economy_map_relevance: NEW (v3-6). Companies and workers BOTH acting on AI fear. Corporate anticipatory displacement (60%) + worker fear (60%) creates bilateral feedback loop. Actual AI-driven layoffs remain ~4.5% but narrative-driven displacement is structural.

running_patterns.description: Entry-Level Extinction: 67% junior dev collapse, 35% all entry-level decline, 37% managers prefer AI over Gen Z. Pipeline destruction with decade-lag leadership consequences.
running_patterns.economy_map_relevance: NEW (v3-6). The apprenticeship function of entry-level work has no AI substitute. 67% fewer potential leaders in 2031-2036. This creates a LONG-TERM human capital formation crisis across all sectors.

running_patterns.description: AI Infrastructure Chain Constraint: NVIDIA $500B backlog → IEA 945 TWh by 2030 → PJM $16.4B capacity auction → copper 766K deficit by 2030 → water stress 1.7B gal/day. Each layer of Jevons cascade constrains the layer above.
running_patterns.economy_map_relevance: NEW (v3-6). AI scaling constrained by multi-layer physical resource chain. Compute demand → energy demand → grid capacity → raw materials → water. The slowest link determines overall AI scaling velocity. Data center occupancy 95%+ by late 2026 = physical capacity crisis.

key_unknowns: Enterprise ROI inflection: When does disciplined deployment ($37B, 3.2x, fewer licenses) convert to measurable EBIT? Task-level ROI is real; enterprise transformation ROI remains elusive.
Perez crash timing: Capital still ACCELERATING ($140B+ frontier raises Jan-Feb 2026). Defense tech exits > investment = Deployment. Crash may be 2027-2028, not 2026.
AI coding productivity truth: Experienced devs 19% SLOWER on complex tasks. Is this temporary learning curve or fundamental Solow Paradox?
Entry-level extinction permanence: Is 67% junior dev collapse cyclical (hiring freeze) or structural (AI substitution)? If structural, leadership pipeline crisis by 2031.
China humanoid robot commercialization: 90% market share in volume but Tesla admits 'no useful work.' When does shipped volume translate to productive commercial deployment?
US federal-state AI regulation resolution: Trump EO vs 280 lawmakers. March 11 Commerce/FTC deadlines. Legal challenges timeline measured in years. Creates maximum uncertainty.
Office CMBS cascade: 12.34% delinquency (above 2008) but bank CRE delinquency only 1.2%. Will CMBS stress transmit to regional banking system?
India AI execution: Zero-tax-through-2047 and $70-100B hyperscaler commitments are unprecedented. Can India's infrastructure (power, cooling, connectivity) support 9.2 GW data center target?
Deepfake trust collapse: Europol 90% synthetic content projection. Does 'Liar's Dividend' create permanent trust destruction or does verification technology keep pace?
College enrollment cliff geographic cascade: 400 schools closing affects 600K students and $18B in endowments. What happens to campus real estate and local economies in IL, CA, NY, PA, MI?
next_cycle_suggestions: PRIORITY 1: Deep dive on Information sector (NAICS 51) — highest Baumol uncovered sector (2.13), 3M workers, internal bifurcation (AI infra grows while content contracts), AI epicenter
PRIORITY 2: Deep dive on Utilities (NAICS 22) — binding constraint on AI scaling, F6 nexus, solar +51.6% growth, nuclear renaissance, PJM capacity crisis
PRIORITY 3: Model FS cascade second-order timeline with CRE data — office CMBS 12.34% → regional bank stress → credit tightening. Year-specific projections
PRIORITY 4: Merge v3-6 scored cards into normalized inventory (create unified v3-6_normalized.json with all 325 models)
PRIORITY 5: Update dashboard.json and UI to v3-6 — integrate 43 signals, 32 cards, sector screener, 3 new patterns, updated force velocities
PRIORITY 6: 6-digit NAICS expansion for top-scoring sectors (defense, financial services sub-sectors)
PRIORITY 7: Model the entry-level extinction cascade (P-037) — which sectors are most affected, what are the 5-10 year consequences for professional pipelines
